revised_title: Isolation and Serial Passage of Bacillus piliformis in Embryonated Eggs
tldr: The author successfully isolated and serially passed two strains of Bacillus piliformis, a mouse pathogen responsible for Tyzzer's disease, in embryonated eggs. This method allowed for the study of the organism and its effects on mice, providing a better understanding of the disease and its transmission. The findings could help in developing treatments and preventive measures for Tyzzer's disease in laboratory mice.
